DataElement.preferredName: Smoking Cigarette Risk Perception Questionnaire Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The act of puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette, cigar, or pipe._Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus._A predetermined set of questions._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Smoking PATH Cigarette Risk Perception Questionnaire 2 Additive-Free
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The act of puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette, cigar, or pipe._A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after theyÂ’ve quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time._Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus._A set of questions or items shown to a respondent in order to get answers for research purposes. [PRO Draft Guidance] See also instrument, survey._The non-affirmative response to a question. (NCI)_A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The act of puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette, cigar, or pipe.

Concepts.definition: The act of puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette, cigar, or pipe.

Property.preferredName: Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study Cigarette Risk Perception Questionnaire No Additive
Property.preferredDefinition: A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after they've quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time.:Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking.:The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.:The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus.:A predetermined set of questions.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics.

Concepts.longName: Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study
Concepts.definition: A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after they've quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time.
Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.

The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: questions from Wave 3 of the Adult Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health Study survey instrument, used to measure a respondent's perception about the perceived risk of smoking cigarettes
